about.label: About the Club
about.title: Where Mountains Meet the Steppe
about.description: Located on the southwestern slopes of the Chatkal Ridge within the Ugam-Chatkal National Park, our hunting grounds span over 35,000 hectares of pristine mountain terrain along the Uzbekistan–Kazakhstan border, part of the Tien Shan Mountain System.

ibex.name: Mid-Asian Ibex
ibex.description: The crown jewel of Central Asian trophy hunting. Pursued across the rugged Chatkal Ridge, these magnificent animals inhabit the highest elevations of our territory.

markhor.name: Bukharan Markhor
markhor.description: One of the rarest and most coveted trophies in the world. The spiral-horned markhor is found in limited numbers across our concession areas.

boar.name: Wild Boar
boar.description: Abundant in the lower valleys and river basins. Driven hunts and spot-and-stalk methods available. Additional trophies at $1,500 each.

roe.name: Roe Deer
roe.description: Found in the transition zones between forest and steppe. A rewarding hunt combining woodland stalking with open-country techniques.

helicopter.text: Helicopter transfer of people and cargo available.
